comment: Shes not that bad. She can come off rude at times but overall shes chill. She doesn't like tardiness and she will lock the door on you. A lot of homework assignments on Aleks. You can have a notecard on tests but you really need to know the material.

There are 3 tests and a final but you get to use a flashcard with notes on them. There is a good amount of homework but they don't take super long. You have to go to class for the lectures but she does post them online without the solutions. She also gives extra credit when going to the review classes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class was pretty easy especially if you're good at math. It is very concept based rather than just equations to solve. She lets you have a note card for every test. You should expect to have a one to two question quiz every week, but they are easy, and you can use notes. The only problem I had was she ran the class like a High School class.

I think she means well, but is not a very good teacher. She races through lectures and doesn't like when you ask questions (is condescending). This class takes up almost all your available time as homework takes several hours to complete each week. The 3 tests + the final exam make up 68% of your grade. Hard to pass unless you are good at algebra.

Do not choose this professor! She is a tough grader and her tests are so difficult. NO EXTRA CREDIT GIVEN BY HER. I did not like her attitude as well when you ask for help. I chose her as my math teacher and I made a big mistake by choosing her as my math teacher in my freshmen year. Please you don't make mistake by choosing her.

Professor B was amazing! Her lectures were straight to the point, and she tried her best to make sure everyone was understanding the material as she went along. Grades consisted of 3 tests, the final, hw on ALEKS, and quizzes (she dropped lowest exam for final). As long as you go to class and study, an A is VERY attainable.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is not a bad teacher but her personality needs work. Her humor can be dry and sarcastic. And hates when you question her. but she definitely knows how to teach. She allows a flash card on each test (Test are just like study guide) Homework quizzes are sometimes open notes. attendance is mandatory!

Her class is pretty chill. If you have questions, ask! I will say though, if it's about something gone over in class multiple times, she's unlikely to answer. She can be a straight-shooter at times, but she definitely wants you to learn the material. If you find the concepts hard to grasp, study sooner than later. Show up to class please!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Very harsh. Makes you feel dumb for asking questions. Make friends in this class, asking her questions won't help you. She gives lots of surprises. Attend every class. She is nice to talk too sometimes, but it all depends on how she feels. Study everything, even if she says you might not need to know it. Very time consuming course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: There is no extra credit given, but her test aren't terrible if you study and you will have lots of quizzes. Grade is mostly weighted on tests and quizzes. She does move through topics quickly. You do have homework every week but it isn't bad. She is willing to help you if you are struggling.

If I would have dropped out when the drop out deadline was there I should have. She doesn't give out no extra credit at all I'm currently failing. I understand what's going on but the tests make it different what it seems. She might do attendance here in there but she doesn't give out that much homework that's the good side for it.
